creator: Lauren Forristal
title: (No AI) YouTube’s latest experiment brings its conversational AI tool to TVs
dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
content: YouTube is testing conversational AI on smart TVs, allowing viewers to ask the assistant questions related to the video they're watching on the big screen.
contentSnippet: YouTube is testing conversational AI on smart TVs, allowing viewers to ask the assistant questions related to the video they're watching on the big screen.

creator: Aisha Malik
title: (No AI) Reddit is testing a new AI search feature for shopping
dc:creator: Aisha Malik
content: A small group of users in the U.S. will start to see search results that include interactive product carousels with pricing, images, and direct where-to-buy links.
contentSnippet: A small group of users in the U.S. will start to see search results that include interactive product carousels with pricing, images, and direct where-to-buy links.

title: (No AI) The AI security nightmare is here and it looks suspiciously like lobster
author: Robert Hart
content:
![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/STKB382_OPEN_CLAW_B_a2aa40.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

A hacker tricked a popular AI coding tool into installing OpenClaw - the [viral, open-source AI agent OpenClaw](https://www.theverge.com/news/872091/openclaw-moltbot-clawdbot-ai-agent-news) that "actually does things" - absolutely everywhere. Funny as a stunt, but a sign of what to come as more and more people let autonomous software use their computers on their behalf.

The hacker took advantage of a vulnerability in Cline, an open-source AI coding agent popular among developers, that security researcher Adnan Khan had [surfaced](https://adnanthekhan.com/posts/clinejection/) just days earlier as a proof of concept. Simply put, Cline's workflow used Anthropic's Claude, which could be fed sneaky instructions and made to do things that it shouldn't, a technique known …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/881574/cline-openclaw-prompt-injection-hack)
contentSnippet:
A hacker tricked a popular AI coding tool into installing OpenClaw - the viral, open-source AI agent OpenClaw that "actually does things" - absolutely everywhere. Funny as a stunt, but a sign of what to come as more and more people let autonomous software use their computers on their behalf. 
The hacker took advantage of a vulnerability in Cline, an open-source AI coding agent popular among developers, that security researcher Adnan Khan had surfaced just days earlier as a proof of concept. Simply put, Cline's workflow used Anthropic's Claude, which could be fed sneaky instructions and made to do things that it shouldn't, a technique known  …
Read the full story at The Verge.

Funny as a stunt, but a sign of what to come as more and more people let autonomous software use their computers on their behalf. The hacker took advantage of […]

title: (No AI) The speech police came for Colbert
author: David Pierce
content:
![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/VRG_VST_021926_Site.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Generally speaking, arcane and mostly unenforced FCC rules are not the province of late night talk shows. FCC Commissioner Brendan Carr seems intent on changing that, though; not long after causing a ruckus that briefly [took Jimmy Kimmel off the air](https://www.theverge.com/news/780471/disney-abc-jimmy-kimmel-live-charlie-kirk), his vague threats appear to have been enough to convince CBS to [tell Stephen Colbert not to air an interview](https://www.theverge.com/policy/880009/stephen-colbert-cbs-fcc-brendan-carr-talarico-interview). Which, of course, became a whole thing.

![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2025/11/Vergecast-Tile-Large.jpeg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

_Verge_ subscribers, don't forget you get exclusive access to ad-free _Vergecast_ wherever you get your podcasts. Head [here](https://www.theverge.com/account/podcasts). Not a subscriber? You can [sign up here](https://www.theverge.com/subscribe).

On [this episode of _The Vergecast_](https://pod.link/vergecast) (which we recorded and published a day early bot …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/podcast/881222/fcc-colbert-talarico-brendan-carr-vergecast)

FCC Commissioner Brendan Carr seems intent on changing that, though; not long after causing a ruckus that briefly took Jimmy Kimmel off the air, his vague threats appear to have been enough to convince CBS to tell Stephen Colbert not to air an interview. Which, of course, became a whole thing.

title: (No AI) Advancing independent research on AI alignment
content: OpenAI commits $7.5M to The Alignment Project to fund independent AI alignment research, strengthening global efforts to address AGI safety and security risks.
contentSnippet: OpenAI commits $7.5M to The Alignment Project to fund independent AI alignment research, strengthening global efforts to address AGI safety and security risks.

title: (No AI) Introducing OpenAI for India
content: OpenAI for India expands AI access across the country—building local infrastructure, powering enterprises, and advancing workforce skills.
contentSnippet: OpenAI for India expands AI access across the country—building local infrastructure, powering enterprises, and advancing workforce skills.

title: (No AI) Gemini 3.1 Pro: A smarter model for your most complex tasks
content: 3.1 Pro is designed for tasks where a simple answer isn’t enough.
contentSnippet: 3.1 Pro is designed for tasks where a simple answer isn’t enough.

title: (No AI) A new way to express yourself: Gemini can now create music
content: The Gemini app now features our most advanced music generation model Lyria 3, empowering anyone to make 30-second tracks using text or images.
contentSnippet: The Gemini app now features our most advanced music generation model Lyria 3, empowering anyone to make 30-second tracks using text or images.

creator: Lauren Goode
title: (No AI) Code Metal Raises $125 Million to Rewrite the Defense Industry’s Code With AI
dc:creator: Lauren Goode
content: The Boston startup uses AI to translate and verify legacy software for defense contractors, arguing modernization can’t come at the cost of new bugs.
contentSnippet: The Boston startup uses AI to translate and verify legacy software for defense contractors, arguing modernization can’t come at the cost of new bugs.

creator: Maxwell Zeff
title: (No AI) Perplexity’s Retreat From Ads Signals a Bigger Strategic Shift
dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
content: The AI search startup once predicted advertising would be a massive business. Now it's betting on a smaller, more valuable audience.
contentSnippet: The AI search startup once predicted advertising would be a massive business. Now it's betting on a smaller, more valuable audience.
